page.title: 09Wareham Social Concerns.
page.content: Help is free.Services cover aged, handicapped and the young,with home_help,meals on wheels,voluntary visitors,day centres and residential home facilities.They help physically handicapped with day centres,various aid adaptions and occupational therapists.They have a home from home scheme where families give people a break by taking an elderly or disabled person on holiday.The mentally ill are helped by support in homes,day centres,admission to hospitals,short stays away from home, adult training centres and help with family assistance.Children are helped through juvenile court,home_help and behavior for those having problems with drugs.They have voluntary child minders who work with probation officers. Con'td on Page 10.
